meanings.definition: The process of recording the electrical activity produced by skeletal muscles.
meanings.sent1: Electromyography helps doctors see how muscles work.
meanings.sent2: During electromyography, electrodes are placed on the skin to measure muscle activity.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's electromyography machine beeped happily as it recorded muscle signals.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the piano keys, each note captured by the electromyography of her hand movements.
meanings.sent5: The electromyography results showed a clear pattern of muscle activity.

meanings.definition: A diagnostic procedure used to assess the health of muscles and the nerve cells that control them.
meanings.sent1: Doctors often recommend electromyography to check muscle and nerve health.
meanings.sent2: The electromyography test revealed issues with the nerve signals to the muscles.
meanings.sent3: The electromyography machine seemed to have a mind of its own, giving a playful buzz during the test.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to fitness was so strong that his electromyography results glowed with vitality.
meanings.sent5: The electromyography procedure provided valuable insights into the patient's muscle condition.
